entry.title: Blind Faith
entry.summary:
Author: AxisMage

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 111,532Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 125

Summary: It's no one's fault but his own that Dick is sitting there now, cold and utterly miserable, and very close to freezing to death.It's no one's fault but his own that he let his heart and mind get away again. It's no one's fault but his own that he wanted for someone who couldn't and wouldn't be his, and Wally is right.Dick needs to get back to his life, start over and make new friends. That's all, nothing more and nothing less. Friends, Dick needs friends, and sadly (according to Wally), Krypto isn't enough.

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,890Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 52

entry.title: Sink In, Stay Close
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,108Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 202

Summary: Jason tilted his head. Studied the way Dick's shoulders had gone rigid, the way his breathing had gone shallow and controlled. "You good?"Dick's eyes flicked up, fast as a flinch. Blue-gray in the bad light, pupils dilated wide. Then down again, tracking the rise and fall of Jason's chest like he was counting heartbeats."Yeah," he said. But his voice sounded scraped raw. entry.title: Transference
entry.summary:
Author: murphy_stoffelis

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,787Chapters: 6/16Kudos: 60

Summary: A violent blight is sweeping through Gotham. Innocent people are suddenly being consumed by rage— with disastrous consequences. With no cure in sight, Jason finds himself working with Batman to save the city from madness.Even with his resurrection a thing of the past, an alliance with the Bats is a harrowing line between reconnecting with a former life and preserving the Red Hood's hard-won autonomy— especially when Jason's partnership with Dick Grayson begins to rekindle a past they've both tried to bury.Because in a city like Gotham, you can't trust who you love. Not even family.

entry.title: Null Signature
entry.summary:
Author: AiKotoba

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,159Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Dick Grayson has seen monsters before. He just never expected to recognize one. The pit is Gotham’s best-kept secret—an underground arena where bio-engineered beasts fight to the death, and the crowds cheer louder for blood than justice. But it’s not the monsters that pull him in. It’s the man behind one of them. Red Hood doesn’t speak much. Doesn’t take off the helmet. Doesn’t miss. He baits the deadliest creature in the ring like it’s an extension of himself—and maybe it is. Dick was only supposed to observe. Now he can’t look away. Because Wrathnir fights like someone who’s trained. Red Hood watches like someone who’s remembering. And Dick’s starting to think the thing in the cage isn’t the only ghost down here.
